metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6369 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the jbg_dec_in function in libjbig/jbig.c in JBIG-KIT before 2.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted image file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6369` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

jbigkit-bin - 2.0-2ubuntu4.1
libjbig0 - 2.0-2ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jbigkit package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0-2ubuntu4.1').
